intro: Sphaerocaryum malaccense, commonly known as the Malacca globe fruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spherical fruits. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and has compound leaves with alternate arrangement. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in cyathium structures typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The fruit, which is a dry capsule, contains several seeds and is adapted for dispersal by animals.
